smells.name: TooManyFunctions
smells.description: Too many functions inside a/an file/class/object/interface always indicate a violation of the single responsibility principle. Maybe the file/class/object/interface wants to manage to many things at once. Extract functionality which clearly belongs together.

instances.message: File 'Extensions.kt' with '11' functions detected. Defined threshold inside files is set to '11'

smells.name: TooGenericExceptionCaught
smells.description: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

instances.message: Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.
Caught exception is too generic. Prefer catching specific exceptions to the case that is currently handled.

smells.name: PrintStackTrace
smells.description: Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.

instances.message: Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.
Do not print an stack trace. These debug statements should be replaced with a logger or removed.

smells.name: VariableNaming
smells.description: Variable names should follow the naming convention set in the projects configuration.

instances.message: Variable names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*
Variable names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*
Variable names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*
Variable names should match the pattern: [a-z][A-Za-z0-9]*

smells.name: MemberNameEqualsClassName
smells.description: A member should not given the same name as its parent class or object.

instances.message: A member is named after the class. This might result in confusion. Either rename the member or change it to a constructor.

smells.name: UnsafeCast
smells.description: Cast operator throws an exception if the cast is not possible.

instances.message: getSystemService(Context.ALARM_SERVICE) cannot be safely cast to AlarmManager.

smells.name: UnsafeCallOnNullableType
smells.description: It will throw a NullPointerException at runtime if your nullable value is null.

instances.message: Calling !! on a nullable type will throw a NullPointerException at runtime in case the value is null. It should be avoided.

smells.name: SpacingBetweenPackageAndImports
smells.description: Violation of the package declaration style.

instances.message: There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of MainActivityTest.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of LoginActivity.
There should be exactly one empty line in between the list of imports and the declaration of NetworkUtils.

smells.name: UnnecessaryParentheses
smells.description: Unnecessary parentheses don't add any value to the code and should be removed.

instances.message: Parentheses in (7 * 60 * 60000) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 7 * 60 * 60000
Parentheses in (30 * 60000) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: 30 * 60000
Parentheses in (hour * 60 * 60000) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: hour * 60 * 60000
Parentheses in (min * 60000) are unnecessary and can be replaced with: min * 60000

smells.name: WildcardImport
smells.description: Wildcard imports should be replaced with imports using fully qualified class names. Wildcard imports can lead to naming conflicts. A library update can introduce naming clashes with your classes which results in compilation errors.

instances.message: com.adityakamble49.ttl.utils.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
android.view.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.
com.adityakamble49.ttl.utils.* is a wildcard import. Replace it with fully qualified imports.

smells.name: MagicNumber
smells.description: Report magic numbers. Magic number is a numeric literal that is not defined as a constant and hence it's unclear what the purpose of this number is. It's better to declare such numbers as constants and give them a proper name. By default, -1, 0, 1, and 2 are not considered to be magic numbers.

instances.message: This expression contains a magic number. Consider defining it to a well named constant.

smells.name: OptionalUnit
smells.description: Return type of 'Unit' is unnecessary and can be safely removed.

instances.message: The function openUrl defines a return type of Unit. This is unnecessary and can safely be removed.

smells.name: UtilityClassWithPublicConstructor
smells.description: The class declaration is unnecessary because it only contains utility functions. An object declaration should be used instead.

instances.message: The class NetworkUtils only contains utility functions. Consider defining it as an object.

smells.name: UseDataClass
smells.description: Classes that do nothing but hold data should be replaced with a data class.

instances.message: The class User defines nofunctionality and only holds data. Consider converting it to a data class.
